clickLocations.title: Fireplace
clickLocations.description: Wood-burning and electric fireplaces are the best options for the environment compared to alternatives. Weigh the efficiency of your fireplace versus your heater, as it may even use cheaper/more eco-friendly to use one as a source of heat over the other.

clickLocations.title: Bed Sheets
clickLocations.description: The textile industry uses some of the most polluting practices on the planet. Consider buying sustainably produced natural or recycled sheets help to reduce the use of synthetics and polition produced by factories.

clickLocations.title: Umbrella
clickLocations.description: An umbrella is a great source of shade on a hot day that does not require much. When buying an umbrella consider the materials and how long it will last to reduce consumerism waste.

clickLocations.title: Solar Panels
clickLocations.description: Solar energy is a renewable free source of energy that is sustainable and totally inexhaustible, unlike fossil fuels that are finite. It is also a non-polluting source of energy and it does not emit any greenhouse gases when producing electricity.

clickLocations.title: Toilet
clickLocations.description:
Consider swapping your toilet to a low-flush toilet. A normal toilet on average uses 1.6 gallons per flush, while a low-flush one can use 1.3.
This may not seem like a big difference, but it adds up. In 2011, the San Francisco Chronicle reported that, while low-flush toilets are estimated to have saved the city of San Francisco 20 million gallons of water per year.

clickLocations.title: Shower
clickLocations.description: A bathtub is a huge waste of water, a full bath can use 70 gallons of water, whereas a five-minute shower takes only 10 to 25 gallons. This can reduce the amount of water we use on a daily basis.

clickLocations.title: Bike
clickLocations.description: Cycling causes virtually no environmental damage, promotes health through physical activity, takes up little space and is economical, both in direct user costs and public infrastructure costs. In short, cycling is environmentally, socially and economically sustainable.

clickLocations.title: Recycling Bin
clickLocations.description: First always reduce the amount of waste you produce, but of you can not reduce consider recycling plastics and other materials, you can find what can be recycled by your local recycling center.

clickLocations.title: Cleaning Products
clickLocations.description:
Sustainable cleaning refers to cleaning habits and methods that individuals can continue to use indefinitely, without worry that their efforts will negatively affect their own health or that of the environment. In other words, it's a maintainable cleaning routine that is good for you and good for the environment.
One great way to do this is use natural products by companies that focus on the environment.
